alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; East Platte County; Goshen County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 9:09PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Goshen, north central Laramie and southeastern Platte Counties through 945 PM MDT... At 909 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles southeast of Chugwater, or 32 miles north of Cheyenne, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Goshen, north central Laramie and southeastern Platte Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; East Platte County; Goshen County
